com.ibm.jikes.skij.misc
Class SkijSecurityManager

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.SecurityManager
        |
        +--com.ibm.jikes.skij.misc.SkijSecurityManager
public class SkijSecurityManager
extends SecurityManager

Create a security manager whose policy is determined by a Scheme procedure. Note: use with caution.

Constructor Detail

SkijSecurityManager

public SkijSecurityManager(Procedure p)
The procedure is called with a variable number of arguments. The first is a string specifying the operation that is trying to be approved (same as the method name); the remaining arguments are the arguments to that method. The procedure should return true to approve the operation, or false to cause a SecurityException to be thrown. Note: use with caution. There is no guarantee that a program can't find away around the security checks here. For instance, it might be able to get ahold of the procedure and alter it.
Method Detail

bypassing

public Object bypassing(Procedure p)                 throws SchemeException
Procedure p must be a thunk, which is run with security checks bypassed.

bypassing

public Object bypassing(Procedure p,                        Environment e)                 throws SchemeException

noBypassing

public Object noBypassing(Procedure p)                   throws SchemeException
Run the procedure (a thunk) with the ability to bypass turned off... is this baroque or what?
